messageBody:
Hi,
i build a test to verify my library before deploying it. But I have to
run the tests with several JREs in order to be sure that the lib runs
properly with all jres our customers have.
today, IÂ´m using a batch file where I call the Testrunner and of
course I can check the exit code. But all this is in a batch file, not
in one test at all. So I set up a test where I simply called the
normal test by

Process p = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(command);
p.waitFor();
int code = p.exitValue();
assertEquals("Test failed",0,code);


where as command is the full java call including the different
jre/bin/java.exe.

The problem here is, that the single test called with exec() does not
return.

Any ideas how to run a test with several JREs from within another test?

Thanks in advance, friedhelm
